metadata.name: Netsh Allow Group Policy on Microsoft Defender Firewall
metadata.comment: Adversaries may modify system firewalls in order to bypass controls limiting network usage

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\netsh.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('netsh.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('advfirewall')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('firewall')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('set')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('rule')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('group=')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('new')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('enable=yes')))

output.summary: Adversaries may modify system firewalls in order to bypass controls limiting network usage

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administration activity References: https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/f339e7da7d05f6057fdfcdd3742bfcf365fee2a9/atomics/T1562.004/T1562.004.md#atomic-test-3---allow-smb-and-rdp-on-microsoft-defender-firewall, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/troubleshoot/windows-server/networking/netsh-advfirewall-firewall-control-firewall-behavior
